brainly_data.question: Throughout the 1970s and 80s, the "Moral Majority" played a very influential role in U.S. politics. Which of these measures did the group campaign for? A) passage of "Affirmative Action" legislation B) a nation-wide ban on abortion and homosexuality C) term limits for U.S. Senators and Representatives D) a reduction in censorship of American media and entertainment
brainly_data.subject: History

all_answers.question: Throughout the 1970s and 80s, the "Moral Majority" played a very influential role in U.S. politics. Which of these measures did the group campaign for? A) passage of "Affirmative Action" legislation B) a nation-wide ban on abortion and homosexuality C) term limits for U.S. Senators and Representatives D) a reduction in censorship of American media and entertainment
all_answers.subject: History
all_answers.text: Throughout the 1970s and 80s, the "Moral Majority" played a very influential role in U.S. politics.  The measures that the group campaigned for was a nation-wide ban on abortion and homosexuality.

top_answer.question: Throughout the 1970s and 80s, the "Moral Majority" played a very influential role in U.S. politics. Which of these measures did the group campaign for? A) passage of "Affirmative Action" legislation B) a nation-wide ban on abortion and homosexuality C) term limits for U.S. Senators and Representatives D) a reduction in censorship of American media and entertainment
top_answer.subject: History
top_answer.text: Throughout the 1970s and 80s, the "Moral Majority" played a very influential role in U.S. politics.  The measures that the group campaigned for was a nation-wide ban on abortion and homosexuality.
